title: Comcast login fails
content: I have used Thunderbird for many years without a issue. But as of a couple days ago I have been getting errors when I open Thunderbird. 1) It always ask me to login even after I save the password to always login. 2) I get this message: "Login to server imap.comcast.net with username caulkerguy@comcast.net failed." 3) Then I get this error message "Alert from account caulkerguy@comcast.net 1014." I have checked all my Server settings and all are correct as per your online settings. I have searched the web and have not found any fixes. Are there any fixes or work arounds? I would hate to stop using Thunderbird as I really like it! I have included 2 screenshots.Thanks for any and all help! Mike: caulkerguy@comcast.net or caulkerguy@gmail.com
creator: caulkerguy1

title: All emails going to junk folder
content: All my emails are going into the junk folder, HELP!!
creator: phatyoda

title: Multiple password request popups
content: There is an account in my Thunderbird settings for which I have forgotten the Password, and a popup informs me of this. However when I click Cancel, the popup pops up again and again every minute or two, till if if left alone, the plethora of popups fills the screen. How can I make it request the password only once, and not keep opening popups? It may be some days before I can retrieve the password.
creator: dwmusic

title: passoword - senha
content: maneira de o thunderbird nao abrir mesmo se vc nao por a senha ou dar cancelar. pois ao cancelar ele abre e pode se ler todos os emails mesmo sem a senha.
creator: dogopirata

title: Loss of emails. folders, accounts etc after an unrequested Thunderbird update.
content: A while ago I had an unwanted update of Thunderbird, and lost emails and local folders, some of which were very important. Can you please advise how I can recover them. Regards Colin.
creator: colink1946

title: Contact sidebar shrunk in height
content:
I was upgraded to TB 115 when I had to get a new computer. I have become quite used to using userchrome to highly personalise my TB, mainly to restore previous features.

However, somehow, in making the "Write" screen the way I like it, I have shrunk the section of the Contacts Sidebar which contains the actual addresses/contacts, down to the point where only one contact is visible. There is a scroll bar so I can see the other addresses are there. It is just that the bottom border of that box has elevated itself and there is a mass of blank space below.

I am sure I have caused it with some code, however everything I have tried to adjust only works on the heading part of the Contacts Sidebar, not the panel with the addresses. I have searched the net to find out what that panel is officially called, without success.

Could a helpful person tell me the "official" name (to use in the css) of that panel so that I can fix it? Or even write me a little code to make that box go back to default?

Just for context, the reason I was fiddling with it was because the panel is excessively spaced, and I was trying to compact the contacts together.

Thanks Fiona
creator: pandf

title: Downloading email messages
content: My Thunderbird is continually downloading email messages, severely affecting its functionality, making it unusable. How can I reset it.
creator: timjepson

title: i lost my archief map in mail mailaccount
content: I lost my archief map in my mail
creator: janzuidersma

title: No support of 64bit PKCS#11 drivers for signing device (i.e. smart cards) on 64bit Thunderbird
content:
Hi, I have a 115.6.1 (64-bit) version of Mozilla Thunderbird, and yet the device manager does not accept 64bit PKCS11 drivers (from C:\Windows\SysWOW64) for smart cards (tried several smart cards). It only accepts 32bit drivers. I have a smart card which does not have a 32bit PKCS11 driver.

Does anyone know why a 64bit version of thunderbird does not support 64bit PKCS11 drivers? Would any of the developers be able to address this please?

Thank you.
creator: kralpatr

title: emails being sent as plain/text only
content:
I have 'Compose messages in HTML format' set in 'Composition & Addressing' but over last couple of weeks outgoing emails have been sent as plain/text only (not multipart with html part). If I include an image - then they are sent multipart (as have to!) text/plain text/html image/jpeg.

I'm on 115.6.0 (64-bit) on Ubuntu 22.04.03

I can't see other recent reports of this issue - any thoughts?
creator: jon109

title: Threading / Unthreading
content:
Hello. As I see from other discussions topics, threaded folders are NOT popular. PLEASE can you offer an option, across the whole of Thunderbird, for NOT having emails threaded. Thuis INCLUDES, when using the Search features, where the reults appear as threaded, which is counter intuitive when searching for one particular message.

THanks David SELIG (faithful user)
creator: davidselig

title: Dragging message to a different folder doesn't highlight the drop folder
content:
When dragging an email to a different folder....

Prior versions of Thunderbird would highlight the folder you are dragging to, which helps you to be sure it will go into the correct folder. Supernova does not highlight the folder where the emails will be dropped. It moves the message just fine, however...unable to be sure that message is dropped in the correct place.

According to an old forum, this was an issue 13 years ago as well.

Thanks!
creator: barnboy

title: How long for a response to a bug report?
content: A week ago I reported a bug in 115, https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1875103 , which forced me back to 102. This is so far untriaged. Can anyone say roughly how long it will be before this is picked up by the dev team for review? Thanks
creator: cjg.aptl

title: Proteção de Senha Salva
content:
Olá a todos, estou avaliando a utilização do Thunderbird nos computadores da empresa, instalei primeiramente no meu pc e estou em duvida quando a proteção de senha.

Ao configurar a caixa de email, observei que a senha de acesso ao email fica salva em senhas memorizadas, o que não poderia acontecer pois o funcionário poderia ter acesso a senha do email. Pesquisei e achei a opção de colocar uma senha mestre ou senha principal, mas neste caso toda vez que o funcionario for abir a caixa de email , vai solicitar a senha meste/principal para ele poder trabalhar, e junto com isso ter acesso novamente as senhas memorizadas.

Alguém sabe se existe uma forma de não deixar a senha memorizada exposta ? Tem alguma forma para resolver essa situação ?

Desde já agradeço a atenção !

Obrigado.
creator: healthrootsbr

title: thunderbirf email
content: When I open an email I have to scroll back through dozens of open empty tabs which can not be closed to get back to my inbox
creator: dustbunnylove6

title: Thread with Unread option in TB version 115
content: Hello, I have a problem with finding the "Thread with Unread" option in the newest version of Thunderbird 115. In TB version 91 it was in Options > Threads > Thread with Unread and now it is gone. I was looking for a solution in the Google or on the TB forum, but I couldn't find it by phrase. Alternatively, is there newer option to configure the email view so that I can see only threads with at least one unread message? Best regards
creator: p.luczak

title: Ausdruck von Wochentagen nicht möglich
content: Wenn ich den Wochenkalender ausdrucke erscheint nie der Wochentag (Montag, Dienstag usw.), obwohl diese auf dem Bildschirm in der Wochenansicht zu sehen sind. Leider finde ich keine Möglichkeit, dies zu ändern. Können sie mir weiterhelfen? Mit freundlichen Grüßen Gerhard

title: view sorting

title: School issued Gmail with Thunderbird
content: I've never really used Thunderbird before, only played around with it a little with my personal email a few months ago, and then never really came back to it. But, I recently started college and I wanted to use Thunderbird for my school issued Gmail. Every time I try to add it, it says my login is incorrect, even though I've typed in the correct password and given it my username. Is it not working because the email I'm trying to use is controlled by my school? Is there a different procedure for regulated accounts? or is it just not possible? Or am I doing something wrong?
creator: alexbrummel

title: Different font after sending messages
content: When I send a message the writing box shows the characters with the chosen font and the correct size (Corbel - 14px) Once I send the message, opening it again in Sent, the font appears larger (Corbel - 17px) The line-height is also larger. The display of the sent message (in Sent) is the same from the recipient's client. So it seems that the composition settings are not then retained when the message is sent. What could this be due to? I attach two images showing how the text appears when writing, and then instead once sent.
creator: l.amodei

title: Thunderbird Papierkorb

title: Inicio de cuenta
content: Hola Que tal, necesito asesoramiento ya que no puedo ingresar al email, me pide primero la contraseña maestra y luego me pide otra, no puedo actualizar los emails, no me aparecen directamente y tampoco puedo enviarlos.
creator: heidiclair.alcorta

title: Lost access to old emails in Thunderbird
content: I use Thunderbird 115.6.1 on Windows 10 with multiple email accounts. One account closed several years ago, so I disabled syncing with the server but I kept my messages local so I could continue to read them (and reply from other accounts). This is an IMAP account but I was basically using it in offline mode. A few weeks ago, Thunderbird started trying to reconnect to the account automatically. I had turned off "check for new messages at startup", "check for new messages every X minutes" and "allow immediate server notifications" so I don't know why it keeps trying to connect to the server. Now I can't read the emails in that account. The headers are visible in my inbox but when I try to open a message, it's blank; it tries to connect to the server. I contacted the server host (a university) and they say they no longer have a copy of my emails. Is there any way to retrieve my messages from my local profile? ThanksS!
creator: tangri

title: Problem sending mail
content: I cannot send mail from my Thunderbird account anymore. My SMTP settings are allright. Itrie both gate 587 and 465, but both don't work. What to do?

title: Does not display graphics in emails, and will not verify updates
content:
When I recieve an email with a graphic TB will not display the graphic even though view message body is set to "Original HTML". It makes no difference.

Further, when I click on the help, about thunderbird item, it gives me a graphic that it 'failed to check for updates."

I really don't understand what's happened here, and worst, for me at least, I cannot point to any action which would have placed the program in this position.

Does anyone have any ideas? Ken Wagoner Harrisonville,MIssour USA

title: Can I Create a Simple Macro in Thunderbird?
content: I find myself often in need of changing a color of a section of text in an outgoing email. I would love the ability to create some simple macros and keyboard shortcuts to set one of three or four colors. Is there a facility within Thunderbird to do that? If not, is there an add-on that can do that?

title: Thunderbird does not line break for the email (font) I have received
content: Hi, unfortunately my Thunderbird is not doing the line breaks for some of the fonts that I have received in an e-mail. Does anyone know how to fix this? Thanks in advance
creator: Ariardorn

title: I can't log onto Thunderbird.
content: I can't log on to Thunderbird to get messages and trying a new Password doesn't work/help.
creator: victorhart

title: My Thunderbird email is froze
content: About four days ago my email froze & asked for my password to activate imap.mail.yahoo.com. Everytime I enter my password it flags failed & asks for retry or new password. Finally I went directly to the yahoo mail site & logged in with the exact same password. If it works on yahoo mail but not on Thunderbird (anymore) I am at a loss. Can you help me? Thx, Doug
creator: d.morey

title: complete down load
content: unable to complete down load
creator: gallen3601

title: Thunderbird won't retrieve my e-mails for my CenturyLink account.  It started with the Thunderbird update on 1/9/24.  Can you tell me what to do?
content: Since the Thunderbird update on or about 1/9/24, Thunderbird will not retrieve messages on my home account which is at CenturyLink. Please tell me what to do.
creator: ken.barnes

title: Changing where Thunderbird saves emails
content: I have found that Thunderbird currently saves emails and files in a "profile" file under "appdata". This locations is a hidden file and my Backup Software (Toolkit) will not recognize it. Can I change the name of the file location to something that is not hidden?
creator: dmgelvin

title: outlook.com POP3 login blocked, OAuth2 setup form blank
content:
POP3 (via SSL/TLS port 995 with "Normal" password) logins for outlook.office365.com stopped working for me this morning. I gather this may be a gradual deprecation of POP3 by MS:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/clients-and-mobile-in-exchange-online/deprecation-of-basic-authentication-exchange-online

Not sure why it took so long to get around to my account. Trying to switch to OAuth2 as recommended there, however I get an incompletely rendered login screen (see image) when setting up OAuth2.

I followed the steps in this article:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/automatic-conversion-google-mail-accounts-oauth20

... however I was already accepting all cookies and had JavaScript enabled.

The URL works when pasted into a browser, but is unable to redirect back to Thunderbird via localhost to complete the process once the authentication is completed.

Any suggestsions appreciated!
creator: Annihilannic

title: new thunderbird upgrades have messed up my inbox
content: Recently Thunderbird is not displaying new mail in inbox. It shows in my webmail service. It shows if I make a selctive search. It shows in notifications. All new mail does not show nut one or two may. It's just inconsistenct. I have tried the suggestion of re-indexing from the Thunderbord option to do that.
creator: loninappleton2

title: Feature Request: include newly created folder or subfolder in "Recent" list
content: The title says it all. Almost always when I create a folder or subfolder I do this because I want to move some messages into it. So it would be great if the action of creating folder would immediately push it into the "Recent" list. It's only a small improvement, of course, but I imagine that would be very easy to implement.
creator: ftilmann

title: cannot download messages
content: I cannot up nor download messages. I am not the best with fixing computer things but I got this message and I thought you might get a clue from it. My upload and download settings seem to be correct and not changed from then it was working.Error received: An error occurred limit while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error, The server responded: concurrent connectors in AVG exceeded (pass:0) processes:Thunderbird.exe [20], nse 3911.tmp[80]) I hope this explains it.
creator: sylg

title: verizon.net email stopped working
content: one verizon.net email account stopped working but another account still works. reinstalled ok but will not download any messages. the account does work on AOL.
creator: dp014

title: Emails to correct folder
content:
When I receive emails to one of my addresses it goes into the correct folder but I cannot remember how! To make it worse I want emails to go into two folders but how do I do this?

I know this is simple and i have done it before but I cannot work out how.
creator: david1102
